The CATNIP library¶

All the functions in the CATNIP library have been through a QA procedure, detailed in the QA instructions section below. All functions should be:

  • Compatible with Python 2 and 3.
  • Follow pep8 type style guidelines
  • Include a docstring that follows either numpy or google docstring style.
  • Include a doctest.
  • Have a trac ticket and code review associated with them.
  • Have been reviewed by someone other than the original author.

Note: As of Jan 2020 module load scitools/default is currently the preferred software stack.

Useful commands and QA instructions¶

  • Useful commands
    • Getting your own local copy of CATNIP
    • Doctest in brief
  • QA instructions for the function writer
    • Open an issue
    • Create a branch
    • Add your function to the branch
    • Pushing your changes to the remote repository
    • Passing the function to the reviewer
  • QA instructions for the reviewer
    • Check out the function to be reviewed
    • Carry out a code review

CIID tools¶

  • Dew point temperature calculation
  • Find the date range in a cube and construct a constraint
  • Remove Rim
  • Remove Forecast Co-ordinates
  • Sort cube
  • Convert UM stash codes to iris stash codes
  • Date chunks
  • Add bounds to a cube
  • Add a coordinate system to a cube
  • Add unrotated lat and lon coordinates as aux coord
  • Find the common time period between two cubes
  • Calculate a seasonal metric with user defined years, seasons and lat/lon region
  • Calculate wind speed and direction in degrees
  • Add time co-ordinate categorisations
  • Compare two cubes and their co-ordinates
  • Functions to convert lat and lon points from real to rotated or visa versa
  • Extract area from a cube on rotated pole
  • Calculates linear regression parameters and confidence intervals, it also plots the output
  • Regrid a cube to the same grid as another cube and/or set up a regridder to be used multiple times
  • A number of functions that deal with the UM and PRECIS date stamp
  • Wind vector plotting function that can also unrotate winds before plotting
